customer_name: Spring River Zoo - City of Roswell
site_name: Spring River Zoo - City of Roswell

citations.narrative:
In the sheltered portion of an enclosure housing three female gray foxes and one female albino red fox, there are
damaged particle board partitions attached to the chain link walls that are coming apart and splintered in some areas;
sharp points are in areas with which animals can encounter them. Metal posts in this enclosure are also rusted and rough
in some areas that animals can come into contact, as well as porous and difficult to clean.
In the outdoor portion of the enclosure housing two female white-nosed coati, there is a fabric hammock that is frayed with
a few small holes in it that are large enough to ensnare body parts.
Enclosures that contain or are made of material that is damaged pose a risk of injury or death to animals; sharp points are
a risk for cuts and punctures; rusted metal can break and make sharp points and is too porous to clean well; frayed fabric
with holes can cause entrapment, strangulation or be ingested to cause a blockage. The licensee must ensure that
facilities and enclosures are constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved.
Indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the
animals from injury and to contain the animals.
TO BE CORRECTED BY 06/11/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
In the sheltered portion of an enclosure housing three female gray foxes and one female albino red fox, there are 
damaged particle board partitions attached to the chain link walls that are coming apart and splintered in some areas; 
sharp points are in areas with which animals can encounter them. Metal posts in this enclosure are also rusted and rough

In the outdoor portion of the enclosure housing two female white-nosed coati, there is a fabric hammock that is frayed with 
a few small holes in it that are large enough to ensnare body parts. 
Enclosures that contain or are made of material that is damaged pose a risk of injury or death to animals; sharp points are 
a risk for cuts and punctures; rusted metal can break and make sharp points and is too porous to clean well; frayed fabric 
with holes can cause entrapment, strangulation or be ingested to cause a blockage. The licensee must ensure that 
facilities and enclosures are constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. 
Indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the

TO BE CORRECTED BY 06/11/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
